notesStmt.note: Lacunae after folios 19, 55. Folio 15 left blank by the scribe. Ink often rubbed off. Fading. Partly water-damaged.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Novellae on Maimonides' Mishneh Torah by Meir Kohen, a disciple of Meir of Rothenburg.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 leaves each, marked by catchwords and by signatures in Hebrew letters.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 16th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Meir Kohen. Chiddushim 'al Yad Ha-Chazakah. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 45.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Joseph Schönblum: purchased by the British Museum from him on 25 May 1867: inscribed, folio [127v].
